title: Aung San Suu Kyi Sentenced to Four Years in Myanmar Prison
sub_head: Guilty verdicts for incitement and breaching pandemic rules are first in raft of charges brought against the ousted leader by the military
body:
Myanmar’s ousted civilian leader, Aung San Suu Kyi, was sentenced to four years imprisonment after being found guilty on two charges, the first verdicts in a raft of criminal cases that the country’s military has brought against her since seizing power 10 months ago.
The Nobel Peace Prize winner and leader of the country’s democracy movement has been tried behind closed doors. Ms. Suu Kyi, 76, was convicted of charges of incitement and violating pandemic rules, according to a person familiar with the case. She got two years for each of the charges, which are among a dozen that have been brought against her by the military.
